title: Unfi Security Gateway (Preview)
descriptionMarkdown: The UniFi Security Gateway extends the UniFi Enterprise System to provide cost-effective, reliable routing and advanced security for your network.  Unifi Security Gateway does not output CEF by default, Logstash is used to parse message into CEF for this connector. By connecting your CEF logs to Azure Sentinel, you can take advantage of search & correlation, alerting, and threat intelligence enrichment for each log.

value:

| where DeviceProduct == "USG"
| summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)

instructionSteps.title: 1. Linux Syslog agent configuration
instructionSteps.description:
Install and configure the Linux agent to collect your Common Event Format (CEF) Syslog messages and forward them to Azure Sentinel.

> Notice that the data from all regions will be stored in the selected workspace

innerSteps.title: 1.1 Select or create a Linux machine
innerSteps.description: Select or create a Linux machine that Azure Sentinel will use as the proxy between your security solution and Azure Sentinel this machine can be on your on-prem environment, Azure or other clouds.

innerSteps.title: 1.2 Install the CEF collector on the Linux machine
innerSteps.description:
Install the Microsoft Monitoring Agent on your Linux machine and configure the machine to listen on the necessary port and forward messages to your Azure Sentinel workspace. The CEF collector collects CEF messages on port 514 TCP.

> 1. Make sure that you have Python on your machine using the following command: python -version.

> 2. You must have elevated permissions (sudo) on your machine.

innerSteps.title: 1.3 Install Elastic Logstash on the Linux Machine
innerSteps.description:
Install Logstash on your Linux machine and use the provided configuration to parse the messages.

> 1. Make sure that you have Java on your machine using the following command: java -version.

> 2. Install Logstash using the instrcutions provided at https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/logstash/current/installing-logstash.html.

> 3. Enable the Logstash service to auto start.

parameters.label: Run the following command to download the provided configuration

innerSteps.title: 1.4 Optional: Download the configuration to collect NetFlow
innerSteps.description: Unifi Security Gateway supports sending NetFlow logs.  If you wish to collect these you will need an additional Logstash configuration.

parameters.label: Run the following command to download the provided NetFlow configuartion
parameters.value:
sudo /usr/share/logstash/bin/logstash-plugin install microsoft-logstash-output-azure-loganalytics
sudo wget -o /etc/logstash/conf.d/ui-netflow-logstash.conf https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/master/DataConnectors/UnifiSG/ui-netflow-logstash.conf
sudo sed -i 's/"workspaceid"/"{0}"/g' /etc/logstash/conf.d/ui-netflow-logstash.conf
sudo sed -i 's/"workspacekey"/"{1}"/g' /etc/logstash/conf.d/ui-netflow-logstash.conf

instructionSteps.title: 2. Forward Unifi Security Gateway logs to Logstash
instructionSteps.description: Configure the USG for Remote logging.

innerSteps.title: 2.1 Configure the USG to send logs via syslog to Logstash using port 5514.
2.2 Configure the USG o log firewall
innerSteps.description:
Go to Settings -> Routing and Firewall -> Firewall -> Settings
 Set Default Action Logging to enabled for WAN, LAN and Guest Rules.
Click Apply Changes

innerSteps.title: 2.3 Optional:  Configure DNS log collection.
innerSteps.description: Configure DNS log collection on the USG.

parameters.label: Configure logging using the CLI (USG Device) to run the following commands:
parameters.value:
sudo bash
sudo sed -i 's/$output .= "log-facility/$output .= "# log-facility/g' /opt/vyatta/sbin/vyatta-dns-forwarding.pl
service rsyslog restart
service dnsmasq restart
exit
configure
set service dns forwarding options log-queries=extra
set system syslog host <LogstashIP:5514> facility all level info
commit
save
exit

innerSteps.title: 2.4 Optional: Configure NetFlow collection using port 2055
innerSteps.description: Configure NetFlow log collection on the USG.

parameters.label: Configure logging using the CLI (USG Device) to run the following commands:
parameters.value:
configure
set system flow-acccounting interface eth<#>
set system flow-accounting netflow server <ip_address_of_Receiver> port 2055
set system flow-accounting netflow version 9
commit
save
